formula.title: Widmark Formula
items: BAC = (Alcohol(ml) Ã— ABV Ã— 0.7894) / (Weight(kg) Ã— Body Water Ratio) - (Hours Ã— 0.015)
Body water ratio: Male 0.68, Female 0.55
Alcohol metabolism rate: approximately 0.015% per hour
This formula provides estimates and individual results may vary

factors.title: Influencing Factors
items: Higher body weight results in lower BAC

Women have lower body water ratio, resulting in higher BAC for same intake
Fatigue and medication can affect alcohol metabolism rate

Pixel fix only works on stuck pixels; dead pixels cannot be recovered

tips.title: Strategy Tips
items: Keep your largest tile in a corner
Use only 2-3 directions to avoid scattering tiles
Never place the largest tile in the center
Use undo to recover from mistakes

numberBaseball.title: Number Baseball
numberBaseball.description: A brain game where you deduce hidden numbers using strike, ball, and out judgments.
numberBaseball.gameWonMessage: You cracked the number in {attempts} attempts!

rules.title: Game Rules
items: The computer picks a number with unique digits
You guess the number and get judgment results
Strike: Correct digit in correct position
Ball: Correct digit in wrong position
Out: Digit not in the number
Goal: Guess the number in minimum attempts

example.title: Example
items: If answer is 1-2-3 and you guess 1-3-5: 1S 1B 1O
1 is in the correct position â†’ Strike
3 is in the number but wrong position â†’ Ball
5 is not in the number â†’ Out

tips.title: Strategy Tips
items: Use unique digits for your first guess
Remember and eliminate digits judged as Out
Use Ball judgments to narrow down positions
Use the hint after 5+ attempts

wcag.title: WCAG Standards

boxShadow.title: CSS Box Shadow Generator

basics.title: box-shadow Syntax
items: box-shadow: [inset] x-offset y-offset blur spread color
X Offset: positive=right, negative=left shadow direction
Y Offset: positive=down, negative=up shadow direction
Blur: shadow blur amount (0=sharp, higher=softer)
Spread: shadow expand/shrink size
Multiple shadows can be stacked separated by commas

tips.title: Design Tips
items: For natural shadows, set Y offset larger than X offset
Blur value about 2x the offset looks natural
Using colors with transparency (rgba) gives a more refined effect
Multiple layers can express depth perception
Neumorphism effect combines light/dark two shadows

rule.title: 50/30/20 Rule Analysis
rule.description: Ideally, allocate 50% of income to needs, 30% to wants, and 20% to savings/investments.

rec.needsHigh: Needs exceed 55% of income. Consider reducing housing or communication costs.
rec.wantsHigh: Wants exceed 35% of income. Try cutting back on dining out or leisure spending.
rec.savingLow: Savings rate is below 15%. Consider setting up automatic savings transfers.
rec.good: Your budget aligns well with the 50/30/20 rule. Great job!
rec.overBudget: Total expenses exceed your income. Review all spending categories.

usage.title: How to Use
items: Enter your monthly income (after-tax salary, side income, etc.)
Enter amounts for each expense category or adjust with sliders
Review the donut chart and category bar graphs
Compare with the 50/30/20 rule to find improvements
Save your budget to load later

rule.title: What is the 50/30/20 Rule?
items: Needs (50%): Housing, food, transport, communication, insurance, medical - essential expenses
Wants (30%): Dining out, leisure, shopping, hobbies - discretionary spending
Savings (20%): Savings accounts, investments, emergency fund - building for the future

tips.title: Saving Tips
items: Food expenses should be 15-20% of income
Identify fixed costs (housing, communication) first
Budget for social events by dividing annual total by 12
Aim for at least 20% savings rate
Compare with Korean averages to find areas to cut back

taxSection.title: Korean Auto Tax
items: Non-commercial cars: 80 KRW/cc (up to 1000cc), 140 KRW/cc (up to 1600cc), 200 KRW/cc (over 1600cc)
30% education tax is added
5% annual discount after 3 years of age (max 50%)
Electric vehicles: flat 130,000 KRW/year
Prepay in January or March for ~10% discount

savingsSection.title: Cost Saving Tips
items: Light cars save significantly on tax and insurance
Eco-driving (avoid rapid acceleration/braking) saves 10-20% on fuel
Use insurance comparison sites to find the best rates
Self car wash and self-service fuel save costs
Use Hi-Pass discount time slots for toll savings

maintenanceSection.title: Maintenance Tips
items: Change engine oil every 10,000km or 6 months
Check tire pressure regularly
Inspect brake pad wear limit lines
Replace cabin air filter annually
Check coolant antifreeze ratio before winter

depreciationSection.title: Understanding Depreciation
items: Highest depreciation occurs in the first year (about 20-30%)
Depreciation slows down after 3-5 years
Imported cars depreciate faster than domestic ones
Popular models and white/black colors retain higher resale value
Regular maintenance records increase used car value
